bibl.title: Despatch from Charles H. J. Taylor to James D. Porter, June 30, 1887
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Chas. H. J. Taylor to Hon. Jas. D. Porter
1. Record of Treasury Fees 2. Arrival & departures of A'a Vessels 3. Digest of the invoice Book 4. Gen'l quarterly account 5. Contingent acc't for June 3d- 87
No. 5 U.S. Consulate Monrovia Liberia June 30th 1887
Hon Jas D Porter Ass't Sec. of State, Washington D.C.

Sir: Please find enclosed my report for the 2nd quarter ending June 30th 1887. I am unable to furnish the Department with Couchers for expenses incurred, on acc't of Contingent allowance, as shown in enclosure No 5, The only item for which I can be held accountable is The Postage for the quarter the remainder of the account belongs to Mr S. S. Sevier. My Salary account will be found in enclosure 4, which I hope is correct. I

would most respectfully call your attention to enclosures 3, 2 and 1, containing digest of the invoice book, arrival and departure of American vessels and the acc't of treasury fees rec'd at this consulate. Mr S. S Sevier, was unable to account to me for the $22 00/100 rec'd by him as Treasury fees, during this quarter. Trusting that this account may be easily understood, I am your obediant servant re. re.
Chas H. J. Taylor U.S. Consul Gen'l
